    Spoiler: General Rules
    1.) The most important rule - ALWAYS be respectful to the other players. Remember to attack the argument and not the player. If things get too heated I will step in as necessary. Each individual player will be afforded a single warning for breaking the rules against personal attacks. Breaking the rules after being warned will result in being force-replaced.

    2.) Day Phases will be 2 weeks long, and only extended as necessary. Night Phases will be 3 days long.

    3.) During the Day Phase players will vote on who they want lynched. When a majority of players have voted for a player that player will be lynched and the Day Phase will end.

    4.) During the Night phase players will submit any Night Actions they have.

    5.) No trick votes. If I think it is a vote or it looks like a vote I will count it.

    6.) If you aren't sure about anything, ask me. I will answer any question as I am able as long as it doesn't break the integrity of the game.

    7.) If you think I've made a mistake, PLEASE let me know and I'll try to correct any mistakes I may have made.

    8.) Don't quote your role PM or mod communications or even pretend to. Breaking this rule will result in an immediate modkill.

    9.) Not_Mafia is the backup mod for this game. I'll remind everyone at the end of the Day Phase, but any Actions that are submitted to me privately should also be sent to him.

    10.) #BF8500 is my color. Don't use it.

    11.) Town Wincon is to eliminate all threats to the Town. Mafia Wincon is to reach 50% of the votes.

    12.) If a player has not posted in the past 48 hours during the Day I will prod them (weekends will count as a single 24 hours). I will force replace anyone who is prodded 3 times.

    Open Setup:
    1 Town Cop
    1 Jailkeeper
    8 Vanilla Townies
    3 Mafia Goons
    Spoiler: Role PMs
    You are a Town Cop.
    Each Night Phase you may target a player and learn their alignment.
    You win when all threats to the Town are eliminated.

    You are a Town Jailkeeper.
    Each Night Phase you may target a player. This player will be protected from being Night Killed but will also be prevented from taking any Night Action they may have.
    You win when all threats to the Town are eliminated.

    You are a Vanilla Townie.
    You win when all threats to the Town are eliminated.

    You are a Mafia Goon.
    Each Night Phase you or a teammate may choose a player to kill.
    During the Night Phase you may talk with your teammates here: [PT link goes here]
    You win when your team controls 50% of the votes in play.

    Spoiler: Cop's results PMs
    Your target is Town.

    Your target is Mafia.

    You were prevented from taking any action.


    Events:
    D1 begins!
    D1 ends!
    D2 begins!
    D2 ends!
    D3 begins!
    D3 ends!
    D4 begins!
    D4 ends!
    D5 begins!
    D6 begins!

Role PMs are in the process of being sent out. The game will start when 11/13 players have confirmed. Please confirm your role by PM when you receive it. This will also be mentioned in the role PMs.

So far 11/13 have confirmed.

I'm experienced in fast-paced mafia games that generally take 20-30 minutes. My approach to those games is based on logic and tone, but they go by so quickly that my approach to forum mafia (tries, at least) to be based solely on logic. Forum mafia lets you choose your words so carefully that basing reads on tone doesn't work nearly as well as finding flaws/holes in what people are doing.

Why are we town v town?


But clearly, trying to read games based solely on logic just isn't working out for me. It got me to figure out that Boon was scum, but it definitely hasn't helped me read players like Mulch/BV/Creature. If I approached reading Mulch from a tone/gut perspective instead of a solely logical perspective, I honestly think I could have figured out that he was town, because looking back his tone is so damn towny, but I was so caught up in all the ways that he had made logical errors that I just couldn't believe that he could be town.

I understand now that a big part of the problem of this game, and probably a reason why I'm gonna get lynched, is because my approach to the entire game has been incorrect. I need to start basing my reads largely on tone/intuition/gut, because trying to catch people logically just doesn't work. People are people, and people are going to make mistakes.

So, this is a realization that's likely to be too little too late - but it's the best I can do. I think that adding this new approach together with looking at this game with a fresh pair of eyes, BlackVoid is the last mafia here.
